io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.entities

Class Vertex

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.entities.Vertex

  • public class Vertex
extends java.lang.Object
    A Vertex represents a square of the board, and is referenced by a set of two coordinates (row and column indices). Thus, 'e4', 'h8', 'a5' are vertices.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Returns:
        True when the coordinates of the vertex (row and column) are valid.

      • isValidCol

        public boolean isValidCol()
        Returns:
        True when the column is between authorized values ('a' to 'h').

      • isValidRow

        public boolean isValidRow()
        Returns:
        True when the row is between authorized values ('1' to '8').

      • go

        public Vertex go(Direction direction)
        Finds an adjacent vertex from the current vertex, given a direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - Where we are looking for.
        Returns:
        A new Vertex, adjacent to the current vertex, and located in the searched direction.

      • create

        public static Vertex create(java.lang.String value)
                     throws InvalidVertexException
        Parameters:
        value - The text representation of a valid vertex.
        Returns:
        The vertex created from its text representation.
        Throws:
        InvalidVertexException - When the text representation cannot be parsed into a vertex.
